name: Parabola GNU/Linux-libre
install_guide_markdown:
# Parabola GNU/Linux-libre Installation Guide

## About Parabola
- 100% free software distribution
- Uses linux-libre kernel (no proprietary code)
- Based on Arch Linux
- Community-driven

## Prerequisites
- 1GB RAM minimum
- 15GB disk space
- Commitment to free software philosophy
- Advanced Linux knowledge recommended

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get Parabola ISO with XFCE desktop environment

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Write ISO to USB drive

## Step 3: Boot Live System
Boot from USB and access live environment

## Step 4: Install System
Use Calamares installer or manual setup

## Step 5: Configure
Configure system for free software only

install_steps.title: Download Parabola ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Download from parabola.nu with XFCE desktop environment.

install_steps.title: Verify ISO Integrity
install_steps.detail_md:
Always verify checksums for security:
```
sha256sum parabola-2024.12.02-x86_64-xfce.iso
```

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB
install_steps.detail_md:
Write ISO to USB:
```
sudo dd if=parabola-2024.12.02-x86_64-xfce.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M
```

install_steps.title: Boot Live Environment
install_steps.detail_md: Insert USB, restart, select USB in boot menu. Explore free-software-only desktop.

install_steps.title: Launch Calamares Installer
install_steps.detail_md: Click installer icon on desktop to launch graphical setup.

install_steps.title: Install Parabola
install_steps.detail_md: Follow installer for timezone, language, partitioning, and user setup.

install_steps.title: Post-Installation Setup
install_steps.detail_md: Update system packages and configure for exclusive free software use.
